com.appglu.android.task
Class ImageViewAsyncCallback

java.lang.Object
  com.appglu.AsyncCallback<android.graphics.Bitmap>
      com.appglu.android.task.ImageViewAsyncCallback

public class ImageViewAsyncCallback
extends AsyncCallback<android.graphics.Bitmap>

AsyncCallback implementation to load image Bitmaps into a ImageView, displaying a progress View while the image is being loaded and a place holder View if the image fails loading.

Use the ImageViewAsyncCallback(android.widget.ImageView, android.view.View, android.view.View) constructor to load the image into a provided ImageView reference. If a non null View is provided as the second argument to the constructor, then it will be displayed as long as the image is loading. If a non null View is provided as the third argument to the constructor, it will be displayed in the case the image fails loading.

Use the ImageViewAsyncCallback(com.appglu.android.task.ImageViewAsyncCallback.ImageDownloadListener) constructor to receive callback methods while the image is being loaded.

Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
AsyncCallback

ImageViewAsyncCallback

ImageViewAsyncCallback

public ImageViewAsyncCallback(android.widget.ImageView imageView,
                              android.view.View inProgressView,
                              android.view.View placeholderView)
Parameters:
imageView - a ImageView reference from your Activity
inProgressView - a View reference from your Activity or null if you don't want to show a progress view while loading the image
placeholderView - a View reference from your Activity or null if you don't want a place holder view to be displayed when an error occur while loading the image

ImageViewAsyncCallback

public ImageViewAsyncCallback(Object id,
                              android.widget.ImageView imageView,
                              android.view.View inProgressView,
                              android.view.View placeholderView)
Parameters:
id - this object will be set as a tag to the views (view.setTag()) and when the callback returns, the tag will be validated if it has changed or not. This is import if you use the callback in an adapter.
imageView - a ImageView reference from your Activity
inProgressView - a View reference from your Activity or null if you don't want to show a progress view while loading the image
placeholderView - a View reference from your Activity or null if you don't want a place holder view to be displayed when an error occur while loading the image
